Description: Fragment of foot and stem of South Ionian pottery cup; exterior glazed black; edge of foot and underside reserved; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the shape finds parallels with his Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88) The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. for parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.725.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 472)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.546) (Phase 3)
